Original.description: The increase (decrease) in cash and cash equivalents before the effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents held in foreign currencies. [Refer: Cash and cash equivalents; Effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents]

Original.name: EffectOfExchangeRateChangesOnCashAndCashEquivalents
Original.description: The effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents held or due in a foreign currency. [Refer: Cash and cash equivalents]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseInCashAndCashEquivalents
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in cash and cash equivalents after the effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents held in foreign currencies. [Refer: Cash and cash equivalents; Effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents]

Original.name: CashAndCashEquivalents
Original.description: The amount of cash on hand and demand deposits, along with short-term, highly liquid investments that are readily convertible to known amounts of cash and that are subject to an insignificant risk of changes in value. [Refer: Cash; Cash equivalents]

Original.name: CashAndCashEquivalents
Original.description: The amount of cash on hand and demand deposits, along with short-term, highly liquid investments that are readily convertible to known amounts of cash and that are subject to an insignificant risk of changes in value. [Refer: Cash; Cash equivalents]

Original.name: OperatingProfitLossOperating
Original.description: The total of all income and expenses classified in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Profit (loss)]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForDecreaseIncreaseInInventories
Original.description: Adjustments for decrease (increase) in inventories to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Inventories; Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForDecreaseIncreaseInTradeAccountReceivable
Original.description: Adjustments for decrease (increase) in trade accounts receivable to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForDecreaseIncreaseInOtherOperatingReceivables
Original.description: Adjustments for decrease (increase) in other operating receivables to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForIncreaseDecreaseInTradeAccountPayable
Original.description: Adjustments for increase (decrease) in trade accounts payable to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForIncreaseDecreaseInOtherOperatingPayables
Original.description: Adjustments for increase (decrease) in other operating payables to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForDepreciationAndAmortisationExpense
Original.description: Adjustments for depreciation and amortisation expense to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForImpairmentLossReversalOfImpairmentLossRecognisedInProfitOrLoss
Original.description: Adjustments for impairment loss (reversal of impairment loss) recognised in operating profit or loss to reconcile profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Impairment loss (reversal of impairment loss) recognised in profit or loss, operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForProvisions
Original.description: Adjustments for provisions to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Provisions; Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForUnrealisedForeignExchangeLossesGains
Original.description: Adjustments for unrealised foreign exchange losses (gains) to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForSharebasedPayments
Original.description: Adjustments for share-based payments to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForFairValueGainsLosses
Original.description: Adjustments for fair value losses (gains) to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: OtherAdjustmentsForNoncashItems
Original.description: Adjustments for non-cash items to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForLossesGainsOnDisposalOfNoncurrentAssets
Original.description: Adjustments for losses (gains) on disposal of non-current assets to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Non-current assets; Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: OtherAdjustmentsForWhichCashEffectsAreInvestingOrFinancingCashFlow
Original.description: Adjustments to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities for which cash effects are investing or financing cash flow, that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: OtherAdjustmentsToReconcileProfitLoss
Original.description: Adjustments to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Adjustments to reconcile operating profit (loss)]

Original.name: AdjustmentsForReconcileProfitLoss
Original.description: Adjustments to reconcile operating profit (loss) to net cash flow from (used in) operating activities. [Refer: Operating profit (loss), operating]

Original.name: CashFlowsFromUsedInOperations
Original.description: The cash from (used in) the entity's operations.

Original.name: DividendsReceivedClassifiedAsOperatingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from dividends received, classified as operating activities. [Refer: Dividends received]

Original.name: InterestPaidClassifiedAsOperatingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow for interest paid, classified as operating activities.

Original.name: InterestReceivedClassifiedAsOperatingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from interest received, classified as operating activities.

Original.name: IncomeTaxesPaidRefundClassifiedAsOperatingActivities
Original.description: The cash flows from income taxes paid or refunded, classified as operating activities. [Refer: Income taxes paid (refund)]

Original.name: OtherInflowsOutflowsOfCashClassifiedAsOperatingActivities
Original.description: Inflows (outflows) of cash, classified as operating activities, that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

Original.name: CashFlowsFromUsedInOperatingActivities
Original.description: The cash flows from (used in) operating activities, which are the principal revenue-producing activities of the entity and other activities that are not investing or financing activities. [Refer: Revenue, operating]

Original.name: CashFlowsFromLosingControlOfSubsidiariesOrOtherBusinessesClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The aggregate cash flows arising from losing control of subsidiaries or other businesses, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Total for all subsidiaries [member]]

Original.name: CashFlowsUsedInObtainingControlOfSubsidiariesOrOtherBusinessesClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The aggregate cash flows used in obtaining control of subsidiaries or other businesses, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Total for all subsidiaries [member]]

Original.name: OtherCashReceiptsFromSalesOfInterestsInAssociatesAndJointVenturesClassifiedAsInvestingActivities

Original.name: OtherCashPaymentsToAcquireInterestsInAssociatesAndJointVenturesClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow to acquire interests in associates and joint ventures (other than payments for those instruments considered to be cash equivalents or those held for dealing or trading purposes), classified as investing activities. [Refer: Total for all joint ventures [member]; Total for all associates [member]]

Original.name: OtherCashReceiptsFromSalesOfEquityOrDebtInstrumentsOfOtherEntitiesClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from sales of equity or debt instruments of other entities (other than receipts for those instruments considered to be cash equivalents and those held for dealing or trading purposes), classified as investing activities.

Original.name: OtherCashPaymentsToAcquireEquityOrDebtInstrumentsOfOtherEntitiesClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow to acquire equity or debt instruments of other entities (other than payments for those instruments considered to be cash equivalents or those held for dealing or trading purposes), classified as investing activities.

Original.name: ProceedsFromSalesOfPropertyPlantAndEquipmentClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from sales of property, plant and equipment, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: PurchaseOfPropertyPlantAndEquipmentClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow for the purchases of property, plant and equipment, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: ProceedsFromSalesOfIntangibleAssetsClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from sales of intangible assets, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: PurchaseOfIntangibleAssetsClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow for the purchases of intangible assets, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: ProceedsFromOtherLongtermAssetsClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from sales of long-term assets that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Assets]

Original.name: PurchaseOfOtherLongtermAssetsClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow for the purchases of long-term assets that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Assets]

Original.name: ProceedsFromGovernmentGrantsClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from government grants, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Government [member]; Government grants]

Original.name: CashAdvancesAndLoansMadeToOtherPartiesClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The amount of cash advances and loans made to other parties (other than advances and loans made by a financial institution), classified as investing activities.

Original.name: CashReceiptsFromRepaymentOfAdvancesAndLoansMadeToOtherPartiesClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from the repayment of advances and loans made to other parties (other than advances and loans of a financial institution), classified as investing activities.

Original.name: CashPaymentsForFutureContractsForwardContractsOptionContractsAndSwapContractsClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow for futures contracts, forward contracts, option contracts and swap contracts except when the contracts are held for dealing or trading purposes or the payments are classified as financing activities.

Original.name: CashReceiptsFromFutureContractsForwardContractsOptionContractsAndSwapContractsClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from futures contracts, forward contracts, option contracts and swap contracts except when the contracts are held for dealing or trading purposes or the receipts are classified as financing activities.

Original.name: DividendsReceivedClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from dividends received, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Dividends received]

Original.name: InterestReceivedClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from interest received, classified as investing activities.

Original.name: IncomeTaxesPaidRefundClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash flows from income taxes paid or refunded, classified as investing activities. [Refer: Income taxes paid (refund)]

Original.name: OtherInflowsOutflowsOfCashClassifiedAsInvestingActivities
Original.description: Inflows (outflows) of cash, classified as investing activities, that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

Original.name: CashFlowsFromUsedInInvestingActivities
Original.description: The cash flows from (used in) investing activities, which are the acquisition and disposal of long-term assets and other investments not included in cash equivalents, from continuing and discontinued operations.

Original.name: ProceedsFromChangesInOwnershipInterestsInSubsidiaries
Original.description: The cash inflow from changes in ownership interests in subsidiaries that do not result in a loss of control. [Refer: Total for all subsidiaries [member]]

Original.name: PaymentsFromChangesInOwnershipInterestsInSubsidiaries
Original.description: The cash outflow for changes in ownership interests in subsidiaries that do not result in a loss of control. [Refer: Total for all subsidiaries [member]]

Original.name: ProceedsFromIssuingShares
Original.description: The cash inflow from issuing shares.

Original.name: ProceedsFromIssuingOtherEquityInstruments
Original.description: The cash inflow from issuing equity instruments that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

Original.name: PaymentsToAcquireOrRedeemEntitysShares
Original.description: The cash outflow to acquire or redeem entity's shares.

Original.name: PaymentsOfOtherEquityInstruments
Original.description: The cash outflow for payments for equity instruments that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

Original.name: ProceedsFromBorrowingsClassifiedAsFinancingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from borrowings obtained. [Refer: Borrowings]

Original.name: RepaymentsOfBorrowingsClassifiedAsFinancingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow to settle borrowings, classified as financing activities. [Refer: Borrowings]

Original.name: PaymentsOfLeaseLiabilitiesClassifiedAsFinancingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow for payment of lease liabilities, classified as financing activities. [Refer: Lease liabilities]

Original.name: ProceedsFromGovernmentGrantsClassifiedAsFinancingActivities
Original.description: The cash inflow from government grants, classified as financing activities. [Refer: Government [member]; Government grants]

Original.name: DividendsPaidClassifiedAsFinancingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow for dividends paid by the entity, classified as financing activities.

Original.name: InterestPaidClassifiedAsFinancingActivities
Original.description: The cash outflow for interest paid, classified as financing activities.

Original.name: IncomeTaxesPaidRefundClassifiedAsFinancingActivities
Original.description: The cash flows from income taxes paid or refunded, classified as financing activities. [Refer: Income taxes paid (refund)]

Original.name: OtherInflowsOutflowsOfCashClassifiedAsFinancingActivities
Original.description: Inflows (outflows) of cash, classified as financing activities, that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

Original.name: CashFlowsFromUsedInFinancingActivities
Original.description: The cash flows from (used in) financing activities, which are activities that result in changes in the size and composition of the contributed equity and borrowings of the entity, from continuing and discontinued operations.

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseInCashAndCashEquivalentsBeforeEffectOfExchangeRateChanges
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in cash and cash equivalents before the effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents held in foreign currencies. [Refer: Cash and cash equivalents; Effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents]

Original.name: EffectOfExchangeRateChangesOnCashAndCashEquivalents
Original.description: The effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents held or due in a foreign currency. [Refer: Cash and cash equivalents]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseInCashAndCashEquivalents
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in cash and cash equivalents after the effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents held in foreign currencies. [Refer: Cash and cash equivalents; Effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents]

Original.name: CashAndCashEquivalents
Original.description: The amount of cash on hand and demand deposits, along with short-term, highly liquid investments that are readily convertible to known amounts of cash and that are subject to an insignificant risk of changes in value. [Refer: Cash; Cash equivalents]

Original.name: CashAndCashEquivalents
Original.description: The amount of cash on hand and demand deposits, along with short-term, highly liquid investments that are readily convertible to known amounts of cash and that are subject to an insignificant risk of changes in value. [Refer: Cash; Cash equivalents]

Original.name: Equity
Original.description: The amount of residual interest in the assets of the entity after deducting all its liabilities.

Original.name: ProfitLoss
Original.description: The total of income less expenses from continuing and discontinued operations, excluding the components of other comprehensive income. [Refer: Other comprehensive income]

Original.name: OtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of income and expense (including reclassification adjustments) that is not recognised in profit or loss as required or permitted by IFRS Accounting Standards. [Refer: IFRSs [member]]

Original.name: ComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of change in equity resulting from transactions and other events, other than those changes resulting from transactions with owners in their capacity as owners.

Original.name: IssueOfEquity
Original.description: The increase in equity through the issue of equity instruments.

Original.name: DividendsPaid
Original.description: The amount of dividends recognised as distributions to owners.

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughOtherContributionsByOwners
Original.description: The increase in equity through other contributions by owners that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughOtherDistributionsToOwners
Original.description: The decrease in equity through distributions to owners that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughTransfersAndOtherChangesEquity
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in equity resulting from changes that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Equity]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughTreasuryShareTransactions
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in equity resulting from treasury share transactions. [Refer: Equity; Treasury shares]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughChangesInOwnershipInterestsInSubsidiariesThatDoNotResultInLossOfControl
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in equity through changes in ownership interests in subsidiaries that do not result in loss of control. [Refer: Total for all subsidiaries [member]]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughSharebasedPaymentTransactions
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in equity resulting from share-based payment transactions. [Refer: Equity]

Original.description: The amount removed from reserve of cash flow hedges and included in the initial cost or other carrying amount of a non-financial asset (liability) or a firm commitment for which fair value hedge accounting is applied. [Refer: Reserve of cash flow hedges]

Original.name: AmountRemovedFromReserveOfChangeInValueOfTimeValueOfOptionsAndIncludedInInitialCostOrOtherCarryingAmountOfNonfinancialAssetLiabilityOrFirmCommitmentForWhichFairValueHedgeAccountingIsApplied
Original.description: The amount removed from reserve of change in value of time value of options and included in the initial cost or other carrying amount of a non-financial asset (liability) or a firm commitment for which fair value hedge accounting is applied. [Refer: Reserve of change in value of time value of options]

Original.name: AmountRemovedFromReserveOfChangeInValueOfForwardElementsOfForwardContractsAndIncludedInInitialCostOrOtherCarryingAmountOfNonfinancialAssetLiabilityOrFirmCommitmentForWhichFairValueHedgeAccountingIsApplied

[Refer: Reserve of change in value of forward elements of forward contracts]

Original.name: AmountRemovedFromReserveOfChangeInValueOfForeignCurrencyBasisSpreadsAndIncludedInInitialCostOrOtherCarryingAmountOfNonfinancialAssetLiabilityOrFirmCommitmentForWhichFairValueHedgeAccountingIsApplied
Original.description: The amount removed from reserve of change in value of foreign currency basis spreads and included in the initial cost or other carrying amount of a non-financial asset (liability) or a firm commitment for which fair value hedge accounting is applied. [Refer: Reserve of change in value of foreign currency basis spreads]

Original.name: ChangesInEquity
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in equity. [Refer: Equity]

Original.name: Equity
Original.description: The amount of residual interest in the assets of the entity after deducting all its liabilities.

Original.name: AssetsOfBenefitPlan
Original.description: The amount of assets held by retirement benefit plans. [Refer: Defined benefit plans [domain]]

Original.name: LiabilitiesOtherThanActuarialPresentValueOfPromisedRetirementBenefits
Original.description: The amount of liabilities other than the actuarial present value of promised retirement benefits in retirement benefit plans. [Refer: Actuarial present value of promised retirement benefits]

Original.name: AssetsLiabilitiesOfBenefitPlan
Original.description: The amount of assets of a retirement benefit plan less liabilities other than the actuarial present value of promised retirement benefits.

Original.name: EmployerContributions
Original.description: The amount of employer contributions to retirement benefit plans.

Original.name: EmployeeContributions
Original.description: The amount of employee contributions to retirement benefit plans.

Original.name: InvestmentIncome
Original.description: The amount of investment income, such as interest and dividends.

Original.name: BenefitsPaidOrPayable
Original.description: The amount of benefits paid or payable for retirement benefit plans.

Original.name: AdministrativeExpense
Original.description: The amount of expenses that the entity classifies as being administrative, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss.

Original.name: IncomeTaxExpenseContinuingOperations
Original.description: The aggregate amount included in the determination of profit (loss) for the period in respect of current tax and deferred tax, in the income taxes category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Current tax expense (income), income taxes; Deferred tax expense (income)]

Original.name: ProfitsLossesOnDisposalOfInvestmentsAndChangesInValueOfInvestments
Original.description: The profit (loss) on disposal of investments and changes in the value of investments. [Refer: Profit (loss)]

Original.name: TransfersFromToOtherRetirementBenefitPlans
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in net assets available for benefits resulting from transfers from (to) other retirement benefit plans. [Refer: Assets (liabilities) of benefit plan]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseInNetAssetsAvailableForBenefits
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in net assets available for benefits. Net assets available for benefits are assets of a retirement benefit plan less liabilities other than the actuarial present value of promised retirement benefits.

Original.name: AssetsLiabilitiesOfBenefitPlan
Original.description: The amount of assets of a retirement benefit plan less liabilities other than the actuarial present value of promised retirement benefits.

Original.name: ActuarialPresentValueOfPromisedRetirementBenefits
Original.description: The present value of the expected payments by a retirement benefit plan to existing and past employees, attributable to the service already rendered.

Original.name: Land
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing land held by the entity for use in operations. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: Buildings
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing depreciable buildings and similar structures for use in operations. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: LandAndBuildings
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing land and depreciable buildings and similar structures for use in operations. [Refer: Buildings; Land; Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: Machinery
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing long-lived, depreciable machinery used in operations. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: Ships
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing seafaring or other maritime vessels used in the entity's operations. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: Aircraft
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing aircraft used in the entity's operations.

Original.name: MotorVehicles
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing self-propelled ground vehicles used in the entity's operations. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: Vehicles
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing vehicles used in the entity's operations, specifically to include aircraft, motor vehicles and ships. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: FixturesAndFittings
Original.description: The amount of fixtures and fittings, not permanently attached to real property, used in the entity's operations.

Original.name: OfficeEquipment
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing equipment used to support office functions, not specifically used in the production process. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: BearerPlants
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing bearer plants. Bearer plant is a living plant that (a) is used in the production or supply of agricultural produce; (b) is expected to bear produce for more than one period; and (c) has a remote likelihood of being sold as agricultural produce, except for incidental scrap sales. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: TangibleExplorationAndEvaluationAssets
Original.description: The amount of exploration and evaluation assets recognised as tangible assets in accordance with the entity's accounting policy. [Refer: Exploration and evaluation assets [member]]

Original.name: MiningAssets
Original.description: The amount of assets related to mining activities of the entity.

Original.name: OilAndGasAssets
Original.description: The amount of assets related to the exploration, evaluation, development or production of oil and gas.

Original.name: ConstructionInProgress
Original.description: The amount of expenditure capitalised during the construction of non-current assets that are not yet available for use. [Refer: Non-current assets]

Original.name: OwneroccupiedPropertyMeasuredUsingInvestmentPropertyFairValueModel
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment representing owner-occupied property measured using the investment property fair value model applying paragraph 29A of IAS 16. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: OtherPropertyPlantAndEquipment
Original.description: The amount of property, plant and equipment that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Property, plant and equipment]

Original.name: PropertyPlantAndEquipment
Original.description: The amount of tangible assets that: (a) are held for use in the production or supply of goods or services, for rental to others, or for administrative purposes; and (b) are expected to be used during more than one period. Note that right-of-use assets are not included. [Contrast: Property, plant and equipment including right-of-use assets]

Original.name: BrandNames
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets representing rights to a group of complementary assets such as a trademark (or service mark) and its related trade name, formulas, recipes and technological expertise. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: IntangibleExplorationAndEvaluationAssets
Original.description: The amount of exploration and evaluation assets recognised as intangible assets in accordance with the entity's accounting policy. [Refer: Exploration and evaluation assets [member]]

Original.name: MastheadsAndPublishingTitles
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets representing rights acquired through registration to use mastheads and publishing titles. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: ComputerSoftware
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets representing computer software. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: LicencesAndFranchises
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets representing the right to use certain intangible assets owned by another entity and the right to operate a business using the name, merchandise, services, methodologies, promotional support, marketing and supplies granted by another entity. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: CopyrightsPatentsAndOtherIndustrialPropertyRightsServiceAndOperatingRights
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets representing copyrights, patents and other industrial property rights, service and operating rights. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: RecipesFormulaeModelsDesignsAndPrototypes
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets representing recipes, formulae, models, designs and prototypes. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: IntangibleAssetsUnderDevelopment
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets representing such assets under development. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: OtherIntangibleAssets
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: IntangibleAssetsOtherThanGoodwill
Original.description: The amount of identifiable non-monetary assets without physical substance. This amount does not include goodwill. [Refer: Goodwill]

Original.name: Goodwill
Original.description: The amount of assets representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognised. [Refer: Total for all business combinations [member]]

Original.name: IntangibleAssetsAndGoodwill
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets and goodwill held by the entity. [Refer: Goodwill; Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: InvestmentPropertyCompleted
Original.description: The amount of investment property whose construction or development is complete. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: InvestmentPropertyUnderConstructionOrDevelopment
Original.description: The amount of property that is being constructed or developed for future use as investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: InvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount of property (land or a building - or part of a building - or both) held (by the owner or by the lessee as a right-of-use asset) to earn rentals or for capital appreciation or both, rather than for: (a) use in the production or supply of goods or services or for administrative purposes; or (b) sale in the ordinary course of business.

Original.name: InvestmentsInSubsidiaries
Original.description: The amount of investments in subsidiaries in an entity's separate financial statements. [Refer: Total for all subsidiaries [member]]

Original.name: InvestmentsInJointVentures
Original.description: The amount of investments in joint ventures in an entity's separate financial statements. [Refer: Total for all joint ventures [member]]

Original.name: InvestmentsInAssociates
Original.description: The amount of investments in associates in an entity's separate financial statements. [Refer: Total for all associates [member]]

Original.name: InvestmentsInSubsidiariesJointVenturesAndAssociates
Original.description: The amount of investments in subsidiaries, joint ventures and associates in an entity's separate financial statements. [Refer: Total for all associates [member]; Total for all joint ventures [member]; Total for all subsidiaries [member]; Investments in subsidiaries reported in separate financial statements]

Original.name: InvestmentsInAssociatesAccountedForUsingEquityMethod
Original.description: The amount of investments in associates accounted for using the equity method. [Refer: Total for all associates [member]; Investments accounted for using equity method]

Original.name: InvestmentsInJointVenturesAccountedForUsingEquityMethod

Original.name: InvestmentAccountedForUsingEquityMethod
Original.description: The amount of investments accounted for using the equity method. The equity method is a method of accounting whereby the investment is initially recognised at cost and adjusted thereafter for the post-acquisition change in the investor's share of net assets of the investee. The investor's profit or loss includes its share of the profit or loss of the investee. The investor's other comprehensive income includes its share of the other comprehensive income of the investee. [Refer: At cost [member]]

Original.name: ReceivablesFromTaxesOtherThanIncomeTax
Original.description: The amount of receivables from taxes other than income tax. Income taxes include all domestic and foreign taxes that are based on taxable profits. Income taxes also include taxes, such as withholding taxes, that are payable by a subsidiary, associate or joint arrangement on distributions to the reporting entity.

Original.name: ValueAddedTaxReceivables
Original.description: The amount of receivables related to a value added tax.

Original.name: ReceivablesFromSaleOfProperties
Original.description: The amount of receivables arising from the sale of properties. Property is land or a building - or part of a building - or both.

Original.name: ReceivablesFromRentalOfProperties
Original.description: The amount of receivables arising from the rental of properties. Property is land or a building - or part of a building - or both.

Original.description: The amount receivable by the entity that it does not separately disclose in the same statement or note.

Original.name: Prepayments
Original.description: Receivables that represent amounts paid for goods and services before they have been delivered.

Original.name: ContractAssets
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s right to consideration in exchange for goods or services that the entity has transferred to a customer, when that right is conditioned on something other than the passage of time (for example, the entity’s future performance).

Original.name: AccruedIncomeOtherThanContractAssets

Original.name: NoncurrentFinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughOtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of non-current financial assets at fair value through other comprehensive income. [Refer: Financial assets at fair value through other comprehensive income]

Original.description: The amount of non-current financial assets measured at amortised cost. [Refer: Financial assets at amortised cost]

Original.description: The amount of non-current financial assets. [Refer: Financial assets]

Original.name: CurrentFinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMandatorilyMeasuredAtFairValue
Original.description: The amount of current financial assets mandatorily measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9. [Refer: Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, mandatorily measured at fair value]

Original.description: The amount of current financial assets measured at fair value through profit or loss. [Refer: Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss]

Original.description: The amount of current financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income. [Refer: Financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income]

Original.description: The amount of current financial assets. [Refer: Financial assets]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossDesignatedAsUponInitialRecognition
Original.description: The amount of financial assets at fair value through profit or loss that were designated as such upon initial recognition or subsequently. [Refer: At fair value [member]; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMeasuredAsSuchInAccordanceWithExemptionForRepurchaseOfOwnFinancialLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of financial assets at fair value through profit or loss measured as such in accordance with the exemption for repurchase of own financial liabilities, as described in paragraph 3.3.5 of IFRS 9. [Refer: Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMeasuredAsSuchInAccordanceWithExemptionForReacquisitionOfOwnEquityInstruments
Original.description: The amount of financial assets at fair value through profit or loss measured as such in accordance with the exemption for reacquisition of own equity instruments, as described in paragraph 33A of IAS 32. [Refer: Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMandatorilyMeasuredAtFairValue
Original.description: The amount of financial assets mandatorily measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9. [Refer: Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of financial assets at fair value through profit or loss classified as held for trading. A financial asset is classified as held for trading if: (a) it is acquired principally for the purpose of selling it in the near term; (b) on initial recognition it is part of a portfolio of identified financial instruments that are managed together and for which there is evidence of a recent actual pattern of short-term profit-taking; or (c) it is a derivative (except for a derivative that is a financial guarantee contract or a designated and effective hedging instrument). [Refer: At fair value [member]; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, mandatorily measured at fair value]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made at fair value through profit or loss classified as held for trading. [Refer: Loans and advances; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, classified as held for trading]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesToBanksAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made to banks at fair value through profit or loss classified as held for trading. [Refer: Loans and advances to banks; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, classified as held for trading]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesToCustomersAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made to customers at fair value through profit or loss classified as held for trading. [Refer: Loans and advances to customers; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, classified as held for trading]

Original.name: DebtInstrumentsHeldAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of instruments representing indebtedness held by the entity at fair value through profit or loss classified as held for trading. [Refer: Debt instruments held; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, classified as held for trading]

Original.name: EquityInstrumentsHeldAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of instruments held by the entity that provide evidence of a residual interest in the assets of another entity after deducting all of its liabilities, classified as held for trading. [Refer: Equity instruments held; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, classified as held for trading]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMandatorilyMeasuredAtFairValueOtherThanThoseClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of financial assets mandatorily measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9, other than those classified as held for trading. [Refer: Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, mandatorily measured at fair value]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMandatorilyMeasuredAtFairValueOtherThanThoseClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made that are mandatorily measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9, other than those classified as held for trading. [Refer: Loans and advances; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, mandatorily measured at fair value, other than those classified as held for trading]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesToBanksAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMandatorilyMeasuredAtFairValueOtherThanThoseClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made to banks that are mandatorily measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9, other than those classified as held for trading. [Refer: Loans and advances to banks; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, mandatorily measured at fair value, other than those classified as held for trading]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesToCustomersAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMandatorilyMeasuredAtFairValueOtherThanThoseClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made to customers that are mandatorily measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9, other than those classified as held for trading. [Refer: Loans and advances to customers; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, mandatorily measured at fair value, other than those classified as held for trading]

Original.name: DebtInstrumentsHeldAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMandatorilyMeasuredAtFairValueOtherThanThoseClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of instruments representing indebtedness held by the entity that are mandatorily measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9, other than those classified as held for trading. [Refer: Debt instruments held; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, mandatorily measured at fair value, other than those classified as held for trading]

Original.name: EquityInstrumentsHeldAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLossMandatorilyMeasuredAtFairValueOtherThanThoseClassifiedAsHeldForTrading
Original.description: The amount of instruments held by the entity that provide evidence of a residual interest in the assets of another entity after deducting all of its liabilities, mandatorily measured at fair value through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9, other than those classified as held for trading. [Refer: Equity instruments held; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss, mandatorily measured at fair value, other than those classified as held for trading]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughProfitOrLoss
Original.description: The amount of financial assets that are measured at fair value and for which gains (losses) are recognised in profit or loss. A financial asset shall be measured at fair value through profit or loss unless it is measured at amortised cost or at fair value through other comprehensive income. A gain (loss) on a financial asset measured at fair value shall be recognised in profit or loss unless it is part of a hedging relationship, it is an investment in an equity instrument for which the entity has elected to present gains and losses in other comprehensive income or it is a financial asset measured at fair value through other comprehensive income. [Refer: At fair value [member]; Financial assets]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAvailableforsale
Original.description: The amount of non-derivative financial assets that are designated as available for sale or are not classified as (a) loans and receivables; (b) held-to-maturity investments; or (c) financial assets at fair value through profit or loss. [Refer: Derivative financial assets; Financial assets at fair value through profit or loss; Held-to-maturity investments]

Original.name: HeldtomaturityInvestments
Original.description: The amount of non-derivative financial assets with fixed or determinable payments and fixed maturity that an entity has the positive intention and ability to hold to maturity other than: (a) those that the entity upon initial recognition designates as at fair value through profit or loss; (b) those that the entity designates as available for sale; and (c) those that meet the definition of loans and receivables. An entity shall not classify any financial assets as held to maturity if the entity has, during the current financial year or during the two preceding financial years, sold or reclassified more than an insignificant amount of held-to-maturity investments before maturity (more than insignificant in relation to the total amount of held-to-maturity investments) other than sales or reclassifications that: (i) are so close to maturity or the financial asset’s call date (for example, less than three months before maturity) that changes in the market rate of interest would not have a significant effect on the financial asset’s fair value; (ii) occur after the entity has collected substantially all of the financial asset’s original principal through scheduled payments or prepayments; or (iii) are attributable to an isolated event that is beyond the entity’s control, is non-recurring and could not have been reasonably anticipated by the entity. [Refer: Derivative financial assets; Held-to-maturity investments; Prepayments]

Original.name: LoansAndReceivables
Original.description: The amount of non-derivative financial assets with fixed or determinable payments that are not quoted in an active market, other than: (a) those that the entity intends to sell immediately or in the near term, which shall be classified as held for trading, and those that the entity, upon initial recognition, designates as at fair value through profit or loss; (b) those that the entity, upon initial recognition, designates as available for sale; or (c) those for which the holder may not recover substantially all of its initial investment, other than because of credit deterioration, which shall be classified as available for sale. An interest acquired in a pool of assets that are not loans or receivables (for example, an interest in a mutual fund or a similar fund) is not a loan or receivable. [Refer: Derivative financial assets]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsMeasuredAtFairValueThroughOtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of financial assets that are measured at fair value through other comprehensive income. A financial asset shall be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income if both of the following conditions are met: (a) the financial asset is held within a business model whose objective is achieved by both collecting contractual cash flows and selling financial assets and (b) the contractual terms of the financial asset give rise on specified dates to cash flows that are solely payments of principal and interest on the principal amount outstanding. [Refer: At fair value [member]; Financial assets]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesMeasuredAtFairValueThroughOtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made that are measured at fair value through other comprehensive income. [Refer: Loans and advances; Financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesToBanksMeasuredAtFairValueThroughOtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made to banks that are measured at fair value through other comprehensive income. [Refer: Loans and advances to banks; Financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesToCustomersMeasuredAtFairValueThroughOtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made to customers that are measured at fair value through other comprehensive income. [Refer: Loans and advances to customers; Financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income]

Original.name: DebtInstrumentsHeldMeasuredAtFairValueThroughOtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of instruments representing indebtedness held by the entity that are measured at fair value through other comprehensive income. [Refer: Debt instruments held; Financial assets measured at fair value through other comprehensive income]

Original.name: FairValueOfInvestmentsInEquityInstrumentsDesignatedAsMeasuredAtFairValueThroughOtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of investments in equity instruments that the entity has designated at fair value through other comprehensive income. [Refer: At fair value [member]; Other comprehensive income]

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAtFairValueThroughOtherComprehensiveIncome

Original.name: FinancialAssetsAtAmortisedCost
Original.description: The amount of financial assets at amortised cost. The amortised cost is the amount at which financial assets are measured at initial recognition minus principal repayments, plus or minus the cumulative amortisation using the effective interest method of any difference between that initial amount and the maturity amount, and adjusted for any impairment. [Refer: Financial assets]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesAtAmortisedCost
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made at amortised cost. [Refer: Loans and advances; Financial assets at amortised cost]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesToBanksAtAmortisedCost

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesToCustomersAtAmortisedCost

Original.name: DebtInstrumentsHeldAtAmortisedCost
Original.description: The amount of instruments representing indebtedness held by the entity at amortised cost. [Refer: Debt instruments held; Financial assets at amortised cost]

Original.name: FinancialAssets
Original.description: The amount of assets that are: (a) cash; (b) an equity instrument of another entity; (c) a contractual right: (i) to receive cash or another financial asset from another entity; or (ii) to exchange financial assets or financial liabilities with another entity under conditions that are potentially favourable to the entity; or (d) a contract that will, or may be, settled in the entity’s own equity instruments and is: (i) a non-derivative for which the entity is, or may be, obliged to receive a variable number of the entity’s own equity instruments; or (ii) a derivative that will, or may be, settled other than by the exchange of a fixed amount of cash or another financial asset for a fixed number of the entity’s own equity instruments. For this purpose the entity’s own equity instruments do not include puttable financial instruments classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16A-16B of IAS 32, instruments that impose on the entity an obligation to deliver to another party a pro rata share of the net assets of the entity only on liquidation and are classified as equity instruments in accordance with paragraphs 16C-16D of IAS 32, or instruments that are contracts for the future receipt or delivery of the entity’s own equity instruments. [Refer: Classes of financial instruments [domain]; Financial liabilities]

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesAtAmortisedCostGrossCarryingAmount

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesAtAmortisedCostAllowanceForExpectedCreditLosses
Original.description: The amount of the loss allowance the entity has made on loans and advances that are measured in accordance with paragraph 4.1.2 of IFRS 9.

Original.name: LoansAndAdvancesAtAmortisedCost
Original.description: The amount of loans and advances the entity has made at amortised cost. [Refer: Loans and advances; Financial assets at amortised cost]
