Original.description: The increase (decrease) in investment property resulting from net exchange differences arising on the translation of the financial statements from the functional currency into a different presentation currency, including the translation of a foreign operation into the presentation currency of the reporting entity. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: DepreciationInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount of depreciation recognised on investment property. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Investment property]

Original.name: ImpairmentLossRecognisedInProfitOrLossInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss for investment property. [Refer: Impairment loss recognised in profit or loss; Investment property]

Original.name: ReversalOfImpairmentLossRecognisedInProfitOrLossInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount of reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss for investment property. [Refer: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss; Investment property]

Original.name: GainsLossesOnFairValueAdjustmentInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The gains (losses) from changes in the fair value of investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: TransferFromToInventoriesAndOwnerOccupiedPropertyInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount transferred from (to) inventories and owner-occupied property to (from) investment property. [Refer: Inventories; Investment property]

Original.name: TransferFromInvestmentPropertyUnderConstructionOrDevelopmentInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount transferred from investment property under construction or development to completed investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: DisposalsInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The decrease in investment property resulting from disposals. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: DecreaseThroughClassifiedAsHeldForSaleInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The decrease in investment property through classification as held for sale or inclusion in a disposal group classified as held for sale. [Refer: Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]; Property, plant and equipment; Investment property; Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughOtherChangesInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in investment property resulting from changes that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: ChangesInInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in investment property. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: InvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount of property (land or a building - or part of a building - or both) held (by the owner or by the lessee as a right-of-use asset) to earn rentals or for capital appreciation or both, rather than for: (a) use in the production or supply of goods or services or for administrative purposes; or (b) sale in the ordinary course of business.

Original.name: RentalIncomeFromInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount of rental income arising from investment property recognised in profit or loss. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: DirectOperatingExpenseFromInvestmentPropertyGeneratingRentalIncome
Original.description: The amount of direct operating expenses (including repairs and maintenance) arising from investment property that generated rental income during the period recognised in profit or loss, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: DirectOperatingExpenseFromInvestmentPropertyNotGeneratingRentalIncome
Original.description: The amount of direct operating expenses (including repairs and maintenance) arising from investment property that did not generate rental income during the period recognised in profit or loss, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: DirectOperatingExpenseFromInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount of direct operating expenses (including repairs and maintenance) arising from investment property, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: RentalIncomeFromInvestmentPropertyNetOfDirectOperatingExpense
Original.description: The amount of rental income arising from investment property, net of direct operating expense from such property, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. Original.name: CumulativeChangeInFairValueRecognisedInProfitOrLossOnSalesOfInvestmentPropertyBetweenPoolsOfAssetsMeasuredUsingDifferentModels
Original.description: The cumulative change in fair value recognised in profit or loss on sales of investment property from a pool of assets in which the cost model is used into a pool in which the fair value model is used. [Refer: Fair value model [member]; Investment property]

Original.name: RestrictionsOnRealisabilityOfInvestmentPropertyOrRemittanceOfIncomeAndProceedsOfDisposalOfInvestmentProperty
Original.description: The amount of restrictions on the realisability of investment property or the remittance of income and proceeds of disposal. [Refer: Investment property]

Original.name: InvestmentPropertyCarriedAtCostOrInAccordanceWithIFRS16WithinFairValueModelAtTimeOfSale

Original.name: GainsLossesOnDisposalsOfInvestmentPropertyCarriedAtCostOrInAccordanceWithIFRS16WithinFairValueModel

Original.name: FairValueOfInvestmentPropertyWhenEntityAppliesCostModel
Original.description: The amount of fair value of investment property when an entity applies the cost model to measure the investment property.

Original.name: ProfitLossAttributableToNoncontrollingInterests

Original.name: NoncontrollingInterests
Original.description: The amount of equity in a subsidiary not attributable, directly or indirectly, to a parent. [Refer: Total for all subsidiaries [member]]

Original.name: DividendsPaidToNoncontrollingInterests
Original.description: The amount of dividends paid to non-controlling interests. [Refer: Non-controlling interests]

Original.name: CurrentAssets
Original.description: The amount of assets that the entity (a) expects to realise or intends to sell or consume in its normal operating cycle; (b) holds primarily for the purpose of trading; (c) expects to realise within twelve months after the reporting period; or (d) classifies as cash or cash equivalents (as defined in IAS 7) unless the asset is restricted from being exchanged or used to settle a liability for at least twelve months after the reporting period. [Refer: Assets]

Original.name: NoncurrentAssets
Original.description: The amount of assets that do not meet the definition of current assets. [Refer: Current assets]

Original.name: CurrentLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of liabilities that: (a) the entity expects to settle in its normal operating cycle; (b) the entity holds primarily for the purpose of trading; (c) are due to be settled within twelve months after the reporting period; or (d) the entity does not have the right at the end of the reporting period to defer settlement for at least twelve months after the reporting period.

Original.name: NoncurrentLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of liabilities that do not meet the definition of current liabilities. [Refer: Current liabilities]

Original.name: Revenue
Original.description: The income arising in the course of an entity's ordinary activities, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. Income is increases in assets, or decreases in liabilities, that result in increases in equity, other than those relating to contributions from holders of equity claims.

Original.name: ProfitLoss
Original.description: The total of income less expenses from continuing and discontinued operations, excluding the components of other comprehensive income. [Refer: Other comprehensive income]

Original.name: ComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of change in equity resulting from transactions and other events, other than those changes resulting from transactions with owners in their capacity as owners.

Original.name: AssetsToWhichSignificantRestrictionsApply
Original.description: The amount in the consolidated financial statements of the assets of the group to which significant restrictions (for example, statutory, contractual and regulatory restrictions) apply on the entity's ability to access or use the assets.

Original.name: LiabilitiesToWhichSignificantRestrictionsApply
Original.description: The amount in the consolidated financial statements of the liabilities of the group to which significant restrictions (for example, statutory, contractual and regulatory restrictions) apply on the entity's ability to settle the liabilities of the group.

Original.name: SupportProvidedToStructuredEntityWithoutHavingContractualObligationToDoSo
Original.description: The amount of financial or other support (for example, purchasing assets of, or instruments issued by, the structured entity) provided to a structured entity without having a contractual obligation to do so, including assistance in obtaining financial support. Original.description: The gains on subsequent increase in fair value less costs to sell (not in excess of recognised cumulative impairment loss) and losses on write-down to fair value less costs to sell for non-current assets or disposal groups held for sale.

Original.name: InventoriesAtFairValueLessCostsToSell
Original.description: The amount of inventories carried at fair value less costs to sell. [Refer: At fair value [member]]

Original.name: InventoriesAtNetRealisableValue
Original.description: The amount of inventories carried at net realisable value. [Refer: Inventories]

Original.name: InventoryWritedown2011
Original.description: The amount of expense recognised related to the write-down of inventories to net realisable value, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Inventories]

Original.name: ReversalOfInventoryWritedown
Original.description: The amount recognised as a reduction in the amount of inventories recognised as an expense due to the reversal of any write-down of inventories resulting from an increase in net realisable value, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Inventories; Inventory write-down, operating]

Original.name: CostOfInventoriesRecognisedAsExpenseDuringPeriod
Original.description: The amount of inventories recognised as an expense during the period, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Inventories]

Original.name: InventoriesPledgedAsSecurityForLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of inventories pledged as security for liabilities. [Refer: Inventories]

Original.name: OtherProvisions
Original.description: The amount of provisions other than provisions for employee benefits. [Refer: Provisions]

Original.name: NewProvisionsOtherProvisions
Original.description: The amount recognised for new other provisions. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseInExistingProvisionsOtherProvisions
Original.description: The increase in existing other provisions. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: AdditionalProvisionsOtherProvisions
Original.description: The amount of additional other provisions made. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: AcquisitionsThroughBusinessCombinationsOtherProvisions
Original.description: The increase in other provisions resulting from acquisitions through business combinations. [Refer: Total for all business combinations [member]; Other provisions]

Original.name: ProvisionUsedOtherProvisions
Original.description: The amount used (ie incurred and charged against the provision) for other provisions. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: UnusedProvisionReversedOtherProvisions
Original.description: The amount reversed for unused other provisions. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughTimeValueOfMoneyAdjustmentOtherProvisions
Original.description: The increase in other provisions through adjustments arising from the passage of time. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughChangeInDiscountRateOtherProvisions
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in other provisions resulting from a change in discount rate. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughNetExchangeDifferencesOtherProvisions
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in other provisions resulting from foreign currency exchange rate changes on provisions measured in a currency different from the entity's presentation currency. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: DecreaseThroughLossOfControlOfSubsidiaryOtherProvisions
Original.description: The decrease in other provisions resulting from the loss of control of a subsidiary. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughTransfersAndOtherChangesOtherProvisions
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in other provisions resulting from transfers and changes that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: DecreaseThroughTransferToLiabilitiesIncludedInDisposalGroupsClassifiedAsHeldForSaleOtherProvisions
Original.description: The decrease in other provisions resulting from the transfer of those provisions to liabilities included in disposal groups classified as held for sale. [Refer: Other provisions; Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]]

Original.name: ChangesInOtherProvisions
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in other provisions. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: OtherProvisions
Original.description: The amount of provisions other than provisions for employee benefits. [Refer: Provisions]

Original.name: AssetRecognisedForExpectedReimbursementOtherProvisions
Original.description: The amount of assets that have been recognised for the expected reimbursement of other provisions. [Refer: Expected reimbursement, other provisions; Other provisions]

Original.name: ExpectedReimbursementOtherProvisions
Original.description: The amount expected to be reimbursed by another party on expenditures to settle other provisions. [Refer: Other provisions]

Original.name: EstimatedFinancialEffectOfContingentLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of the estimated financial effect of contingent liabilities. [Refer: Classes of contingent liabilities [domain]]

Original.name: EstimatedFinancialEffectOfContingentAssets
Original.description: The amount of the estimated financial effect of possible assets that arise from past events and whose existence will be confirmed only by the occurrence or non-occurrence of one or more uncertain future events not wholly within control of the entity.

Original.name: NoncurrentContractAssets
Original.description: The amount of non-current contract assets. [Refer: Contract assets]

Original.name: CurrentContractAssets
Original.description: The amount of current contract assets. [Refer: Contract assets]

Original.name: ContractAssets
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s right to consideration in exchange for goods or services that the entity has transferred to a customer, when that right is conditioned on something other than the passage of time (for example, the entity’s future performance).

Original.name: NoncurrentContractLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of non-current contract liabilities. [Refer: Contract liabilities]

Original.name: CurrentContractLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of current contract liabilities. [Refer: Contract liabilities]

Original.name: ContractLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s obligation to transfer goods or services to a customer for which the entity has received consideration (or the amount is due) from the customer.

Original.name: NoncurrentReceivablesFromContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of non-current receivables from contracts with customers. [Refer: Receivables from contracts with customers]

Original.name: CurrentReceivablesFromContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of current receivables from contracts with customers. [Refer: Receivables from contracts with customers]

Original.name: ReceivablesFromContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s right to consideration in exchange for goods or services that the entity has transferred to a customer that is unconditional. A right to consideration is unconditional if only the passage of time is required before payment of that consideration is due.

Original.name: RevenueFromContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of revenue from contracts with customers, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. A customer is a party that has contracted with an entity to obtain goods or services that are an output of the entity’s ordinary activities in exchange for consideration.

Original.name: ImpairmentLossOnReceivablesOrContractAssetsArisingFromContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of impairment loss on receivables or contract assets arising from contracts with customers, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Contract assets; Impairment loss; Receivables from contracts with customers]

Original.name: RevenueFromContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of revenue from contracts with customers, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. A customer is a party that has contracted with an entity to obtain goods or services that are an output of the entity’s ordinary activities in exchange for consideration.

Original.name: ContractAssets
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s right to consideration in exchange for goods or services that the entity has transferred to a customer, when that right is conditioned on something other than the passage of time (for example, the entity’s future performance).

Original.name: ContractAssets
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s right to consideration in exchange for goods or services that the entity has transferred to a customer, when that right is conditioned on something other than the passage of time (for example, the entity’s future performance).

Original.name: ContractLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s obligation to transfer goods or services to a customer for which the entity has received consideration (or the amount is due) from the customer.

Original.name: ContractLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s obligation to transfer goods or services to a customer for which the entity has received consideration (or the amount is due) from the customer.

Original.name: ReceivablesFromContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s right to consideration in exchange for goods or services that the entity has transferred to a customer that is unconditional. A right to consideration is unconditional if only the passage of time is required before payment of that consideration is due.

Original.name: ReceivablesFromContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of an entity’s right to consideration in exchange for goods or services that the entity has transferred to a customer that is unconditional. A right to consideration is unconditional if only the passage of time is required before payment of that consideration is due.

Original.name: RevenueThatWasIncludedInContractLiabilityBalanceAtBeginningOfPeriod
Original.description: The amount of revenue that was included in the contract liability balance at the beginning of the period, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Contract liabilities; Revenue from contracts with customers, operating]

Original.name: RevenueFromPerformanceObligationsSatisfiedOrPartiallySatisfiedInPreviousPeriods
Original.description: The amount of revenue from performance obligations satisfied (or partially satisfied) in previous periods, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Performance obligations [domain]; Revenue from contracts with customers, operating]

Original.name: IncreaseThroughBusinessCombinationsContractAssets
Original.description: The increase in contract assets resulting from business combinations. [Refer: Total for all business combinations [member]; Contract assets]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughCumulativeCatchupAdjustmentsToRevenueContractAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in contract assets resulting from cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue. [Refer: Contract assets; Revenue from contracts with customers, operating]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughCumulativeCatchupAdjustmentsToRevenueArisingFromChangeInMeasureOfProgressContractAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in contract assets resulting from cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue arising from a change in the measure of progress. [Refer: Increase (decrease) through cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue, contract assets]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughCumulativeCatchupAdjustmentsToRevenueArisingFromChangeInEstimateOfTransactionPriceContractAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in contract assets resulting from cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue arising from a change in an estimate of the transaction price. The transaction price is the amount of consideration to which an entity expects to be entitled in exchange for transferring promised goods or services to a customer, excluding amounts collected on behalf of third parties (for example, some sales taxes). [Refer: Increase (decrease) through cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue, contract assets]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughCumulativeCatchupAdjustmentsToRevenueArisingFromContractModificationContractAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in contract assets resulting from cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue arising from a contract modification. A contract modification is a change in the scope or price (or both) of a contract that is approved by the parties to the contract. [Refer: Increase (decrease) through cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue, contract assets]

Original.name: DecreaseThroughImpairmentContractAssets
Original.description: The decrease in contract assets resulting from impairment. [Refer: Contract assets; Impairment loss]

Original.name: DecreaseThroughRightToConsiderationBecomingUnconditionalContractAssets
Original.description: The decrease in contract assets resulting from the right to consideration becoming unconditional. [Refer: Contract assets]

Original.name: IncreaseThroughBusinessCombinationsContractLiabilities
Original.description: The increase in contract liabilities resulting from business combinations. [Refer: Total for all business combinations [member]; Contract liabilities]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughCumulativeCatchupAdjustmentsToRevenueContractLiabilities
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in contract liabilities resulting from cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue. [Refer: Contract liabilities; Revenue from contracts with customers, operating]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughCumulativeCatchupAdjustmentsToRevenueArisingFromChangeInMeasureOfProgressContractLiabilities
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in contract liabilities resulting from cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue arising from a change in the measure of progress. [Refer: Increase (decrease) through cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue, contract liabilities]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughCumulativeCatchupAdjustmentsToRevenueArisingFromChangeInEstimateOfTransactionPriceContractLiabilities
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in contract liabilities resulting from cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue arising from a change in an estimate of the transaction price. The transaction price is the amount of consideration to which an entity expects to be entitled in exchange for transferring promised goods or services to a customer, excluding amounts collected on behalf of third parties (for example, some sales taxes). [Refer: Increase (decrease) through cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue, contract liabilities]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughCumulativeCatchupAdjustmentsToRevenueArisingFromContractModificationContractLiabilities
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in contract liabilities resulting from cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue arising from a contract modification. A contract modification is a change in the scope or price (or both) of a contract that is approved by the parties to the contract. [Refer: Increase (decrease) through cumulative catch-up adjustments to revenue, contract liabilities]

Original.name: DecreaseThroughPerformanceObligationBeingSatisfiedContractLiabilities
Original.description: The decrease in contract liabilities resulting from the performance obligation being satisfied. [Refer: Contract liabilities; Performance obligations [domain]]

Original.name: TransactionPriceAllocatedToRemainingPerformanceObligations
Original.description: The amount of the transaction price allocated to the performance obligations that are unsatisfied (or partially unsatisfied) as of the end of the reporting period. The transaction price is the amount of consideration to which an entity expects to be entitled in exchange for transferring promised goods or services to a customer, excluding amounts collected on behalf of third parties (for example, some sales taxes). [Refer: Performance obligations [domain]]

Original.name: TransactionPriceAllocatedToRemainingPerformanceObligations
Original.description: The amount of the transaction price allocated to the performance obligations that are unsatisfied (or partially unsatisfied) as of the end of the reporting period. The transaction price is the amount of consideration to which an entity expects to be entitled in exchange for transferring promised goods or services to a customer, excluding amounts collected on behalf of third parties (for example, some sales taxes). [Refer: Performance obligations [domain]]

Original.name: AssetsRecognisedFromCostsToObtainOrFulfilContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of assets recognised from the costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers. The costs to obtain a contract with a customer are the incremental costs of obtaining the contract that the entity would not have incurred if the contract had not been obtained. The costs to fulfil a contract with a customer are the costs that relate directly to a contract or to an anticipated contract that the entity can specifically identify.

Original.name: AmortisationAssetsRecognisedFromCostsIncurredToObtainOrFulfilContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of amortisation for assets recognised from the costs incurred to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers; Amortisation expense, operating]

Original.name: ImpairmentLossAssetsRecognisedFromCostsIncurredToObtainOrFulfilContractsWithCustomers
Original.description: The amount of impairment loss for assets recognised from the costs incurred to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Assets recognised from costs to obtain or fulfil contracts with customers; Impairment loss]

Original.name: RevenueFromGovernmentGrants
Original.description: The amount of income recognised in relation to government grants, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Government grants]

Original.name: ImpairmentLossRecognisedInProfitOrLoss
Original.description: The amount of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss. [Refer: Impairment loss; Profit (loss)]

Original.name: ReversalOfImpairmentLossRecognisedInProfitOrLoss
Original.description: The amount of reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss. [Refer: Reversal of impairment loss; Profit (loss)]

Original.name: ImpairmentLossRecognisedInOtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income. Impairment loss on a revalued asset is recognised in other comprehensive income to the extent that the impairment loss does not exceed the amount in the revaluation surplus for that same asset. [Refer: Impairment loss; Revaluation surplus; Other comprehensive income]

Original.name: ReversalOfImpairmentLossRecognisedInOtherComprehensiveIncome
Original.description: The amount of reversal of impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income. [Refer: Reversal of impairment loss; Impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income]

Original.name: ImpairmentLoss
Original.description: The amount recognised as a reduction of the carrying amount of an asset or cash-generating unit to its recoverable amount. [Refer: Carrying amount [member]]

Original.name: ReversalOfImpairmentLoss
Original.description: The amount recognised as an increase of the carrying amount of an asset or cash-generating unit to its recoverable amount when an impairment loss had been previously recognised. [Refer: Impairment loss]

Original.name: RecoverableAmountOfAssetOrCashgeneratingUnit
Original.description: The higher of an asset’s (or cash-generating unit’s) fair value less costs of disposal and its value in use. [Refer: Total for all cash-generating units [member]]

Original.name: ImpairmentLoss
Original.description: The amount recognised as a reduction of the carrying amount of an asset or cash-generating unit to its recoverable amount. [Refer: Carrying amount [member]]

Original.name: ReversalOfImpairmentLoss
Original.description: The amount recognised as an increase of the carrying amount of an asset or cash-generating unit to its recoverable amount when an impairment loss had been previously recognised. [Refer: Impairment loss]

Original.name: UnallocatedGoodwill
Original.description: The amount of goodwill acquired in a business combination that has not been allocated to a cash-generating unit (group of units). [Refer: Goodwill; Total for all cash-generating units [member]; Total for all business combinations [member]]

Original.name: Goodwill
Original.description: The amount of assets representing the future economic benefits arising from other assets acquired in a business combination that are not individually identified and separately recognised. [Refer: Total for all business combinations [member]]

Original.name: IntangibleAssetsWithIndefiniteUsefulLife
Original.description: The amount of intangible assets assessed as having an indefinite useful life. [Refer: Intangible assets other than goodwill]

Original.name: AmountByWhichUnitsRecoverableAmountExceedsItsCarryingAmount
Original.description: The amount by which a cash-generating unit's (group of units') recoverable amount exceeds its carrying amount. [Refer: Carrying amount [member]; Total for all cash-generating units [member]]

Original.name: RightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of assets that represent a lessee's right to use an underlying asset for the lease term that do not meet the definition of investment property. Underlying asset is an asset that is the subject of a lease, for which the right to use that asset has been provided by a lessor to a lessee.

Original.name: CurrentLeaseLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of current lease liabilities. [Refer: Lease liabilities]

Original.name: NoncurrentLeaseLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of non-current lease liabilities. [Refer: Lease liabilities]

Original.name: LeaseLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of liabilities related to the entity's leases. Lease is a contract, or part of a contract, that conveys the right to use an underlying asset for a period of time in exchange for consideration.

Original.name: RightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of assets that represent a lessee's right to use an underlying asset for the lease term that do not meet the definition of investment property. Underlying asset is an asset that is the subject of a lease, for which the right to use that asset has been provided by a lessor to a lessee.

Original.name: AdditionsToRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of additions to right-of-use assets. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: AdditionsOtherThanThroughBusinessCombinationsRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of additions to right-of-use assets other than those acquired through business combinations. [Refer: Total for all business combinations [member]; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: AcquisitionsThroughBusinessCombinationsRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The increase in right-of-use assets resulting from acquisitions through business combinations. [Refer: Total for all business combinations [member]; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughNetExchangeDifferencesRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in right-of-use assets resulting from net exchange differences arising on the translation of the financial statements from the functional currency into a different presentation currency, including the translation of a foreign operation into the presentation currency of the reporting entity. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: DepreciationRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of depreciation of right-of-use assets. [Refer: Depreciation and amortisation expense; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: ImpairmentLossRecognisedInProfitOrLossRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss for right-of-use assets. [Refer: Impairment loss recognised in profit or loss; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: ReversalOfImpairmentLossRecognisedInProfitOrLossRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss for right-of-use assets. [Refer: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in profit or loss; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: ImpairmentLossRecognisedInOtherComprehensiveIncomeRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income for right-of-use assets. [Refer: Impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: ReversalOfImpairmentLossRecognisedInOtherComprehensiveIncomeRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of reversal of impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income for right-of-use assets. [Refer: Reversal of impairment loss recognised in other comprehensive income; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughTransfersRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in right-of-use assets resulting from transfers. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughOtherChangesRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in right-of-use assets resulting from changes that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseThroughTransfersAndOtherChangesRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in right-of-use assets resulting from transfers and changes that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: DisposalsRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The decrease in right-of-use assets resulting from disposals. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: RetirementsRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The decrease in right-of-use assets resulting from retirements. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: DisposalsAndRetirementsRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The decrease in right-of-use assets resulting from disposals and retirements. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: DecreaseThroughClassifiedAsHeldForSaleRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The decrease in right-of-use assets through classification as held for sale or inclusion in a disposal group classified as held for sale. [Refer: Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]; Right-of-use assets; Disposal groups classified as held for sale [member]]

Original.name: DecreaseThroughLossOfControlOfSubsidiaryRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The decrease in right-of-use assets resulting from the loss of control of a subsidiary. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseInRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in right-of-use assets. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: RightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of assets that represent a lessee's right to use an underlying asset for the lease term that do not meet the definition of investment property. Underlying asset is an asset that is the subject of a lease, for which the right to use that asset has been provided by a lessor to a lessee.

Original.name: RightofuseAssetsRevaluedAssetsAtCost
Original.description: The amount of right-of-use assets that would have been recognised had the revalued assets been carried under the cost model. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: RightofuseAssetsRevaluationSurplus
Original.description: The amount of the revaluation surplus that relates to right-of-use assets. [Refer: Revaluation surplus; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: RightofuseAssetsIncreaseDecreaseInRevaluationSurplus
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in the revaluation surplus that relates to right-of-use assets. [Refer: Revaluation surplus; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: InterestExpenseOnLeaseLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of interest expense on lease liabilities, in the financing category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Lease liabilities]

Original.name: ExpenseRelatingToShorttermLeasesForWhichRecognitionExemptionHasBeenUsed
Original.description: The amount of the expense relating to short-term leases accounted for applying paragraph 6 of IFRS 16, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. This expense need not include the expense relating to leases with a lease term of one month or less. Short-term lease is a lease that, at the commencement date, has a lease term of 12 months or less. A lease that contains a purchase option is not a short-term lease.

Original.name: ExpenseRelatingToLeasesOfLowvalueAssetsForWhichRecognitionExemptionHasBeenUsed
Original.description: The amount of the expense relating to leases of low-value assets accounted for applying paragraph 6 of IFRS 16, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. This expense shall not include the expense relating to short-term leases of low-value assets.

Original.name: ExpenseRelatingToVariableLeasePaymentsNotIncludedInMeasurementOfLeaseLiabilities
Original.description: The amount of the expense relating to variable lease payments not included in the measurement of lease liabilities, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. Variable lease payments are the portion of payments made by a lessee to a lessor for the right to use an underlying asset during the lease term that varies because of changes in facts or circumstances occurring after the commencement date, other than the passage of time. [Refer: Lease liabilities]

Original.name: IncomeFromSubleasingRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of income from subleasing right-of-use assets. Sublease is a transaction for which an underlying asset is re-leased by a lessee (‘intermediate lessor’) to a third party, and the lease (‘head lease’) between the head lessor and lessee remains in effect. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: CashOutflowForLeases
Original.description: The cash outflow for leases.

Original.name: AdditionsToRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of additions to right-of-use assets. [Refer: Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: AdditionsOtherThanThroughBusinessCombinationsRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The amount of additions to right-of-use assets other than those acquired through business combinations. [Refer: Total for all business combinations [member]; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: AcquisitionsThroughBusinessCombinationsRightofuseAssets
Original.description: The increase in right-of-use assets resulting from acquisitions through business combinations. [Refer: Total for all business combinations [member]; Right-of-use assets]

Original.name: GainsLossesArisingFromSaleAndLeasebackTransactions
Original.description: The gains (losses) arising from sale and leaseback transactions, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss.

Original.name: LeaseCommitmentsForShorttermLeasesForWhichRecognitionExemptionHasBeenUsed
Original.description: The amount of the lease commitments for short-term leases accounted for applying paragraph 6 of IFRS 16. Short-term lease is a lease that, at the commencement date, has a lease term of 12 months or less. A lease that contains a purchase option is not a short-term lease.

Original.name: AmountRecognisedInProfitOrLossForReportingPeriodToReflectChangesInLeasePaymentsThatAriseFromRentConcessionsOccurringAsDirectConsequenceOfCovid19PandemicToWhichLesseeAppliedPracticalExpedientInParagraph46AOfIFRS16
Original.description: The amount recognised in profit or loss for the reporting period to reflect changes in lease payments that arise from rent concessions occurring as a direct consequence of the covid-19 pandemic, to which the lessee has applied the practical expedient in paragraph 46A of IFRS 16, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss.

Original.name: SellingProfitLossOnFinanceLeases
Original.description: The selling profit (loss) on finance leases. Finance lease is a lease that transfers substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of an underlying asset.

Original.name: FinanceIncomeOnNetInvestmentInFinanceLease
Original.description: The amount of finance income on the net investment in the finance lease. [Refer: Net investment in finance lease]

Original.name: IncomeRelatingToVariableLeasePaymentsNotIncludedInMeasurementOfNetInvestmentInFinanceLease
Original.description: The amount of income relating to variable lease payments not included in the measurement of the net investment in the finance lease. Variable lease payments are the portion of payments made by a lessee to a lessor for the right to use an underlying asset during the lease term that varies because of changes in facts or circumstances occurring after the commencement date, other than the passage of time. [Refer: Net investment in finance lease]

Original.name: OperatingLeaseIncome
Original.description: The amount of operating lease income. Operating lease is a lease that does not transfer substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of an underlying asset.

Original.name: IncomeRelatingToVariableLeasePaymentsForOperatingLeasesThatDoNotDependOnIndexOrRate
Original.description: The amount of income relating to variable lease payments for operating leases that do not depend on an index or a rate. Variable lease payments are the portion of payments made by a lessee to a lessor for the right to use an underlying asset during the lease term that varies because of changes in facts or circumstances occurring after the commencement date, other than the passage of time.

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseInNetInvestmentInFinanceLease
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in the net investment in finance lease. [Refer: Net investment in finance lease]

Original.name: UndiscountedFinanceLeasePaymentsToBeReceived
Original.description: The amount of undiscounted finance lease payments to be received. Finance lease is a lease that transfers substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of an underlying asset.

Original.name: UndiscountedFinanceLeasePaymentsToBeReceived
Original.description: The amount of undiscounted finance lease payments to be received. Finance lease is a lease that transfers substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of an underlying asset.

Original.name: UnearnedFinanceIncomeRelatingToFinanceLeasePaymentsReceivable
Original.description: The amount of unearned finance income relating to the finance lease payments receivable. Finance lease is a lease that transfers substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of an underlying asset.

Original.name: DiscountedUnguaranteedResidualValueOfAssetsSubjectToFinanceLease
Original.description: The amount of the discounted unguaranteed residual value of assets subject to finance leases. Unguaranteed residual value is the portion of the residual value of the underlying asset, the realisation of which by a lessor is not assured or is guaranteed solely by a party related to the lessor. Finance lease is a lease that transfers substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of an underlying asset.

Original.name: NetInvestmentInFinanceLease
Original.description: The gross investment in the finance lease discounted at the interest rate implicit in the lease. Finance lease is a lease that transfers substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of an underlying asset. Gross investment in the finance lease is the sum of: (a) the lease payments receivable by a lessor under a finance lease; and (b) any unguaranteed residual value accruing to the lessor. Interest rate implicit in the lease is the rate of interest that causes the present value of (a) the lease payments and (b) the unguaranteed residual value to equal to the sum of (i) the fair value of the underlying asset and (ii) the initial direct costs of the lessor.

Original.name: UndiscountedOperatingLeasePaymentsToBeReceived
Original.description: The amount of undiscounted operating lease payments to be received. Operating lease is a lease that does not transfer substantially all the risks and rewards incidental to ownership of an underlying asset.

Original.name: RevenueRecognisedOnExchangingConstructionServicesForFinancialAsset
Original.description: The amount of revenue recognised when construction services are exchanged for financial assets in service concession arrangements, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Service concession arrangements [domain]; Revenue from contracts with customers, operating]

Original.name: RevenueRecognisedOnExchangingConstructionServicesForIntangibleAsset
Original.description: The amount of revenue recognised when construction services are exchanged for an intangible asset in service concession arrangements, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Service concession arrangements [domain]; Revenue from contracts with customers, operating]

Original.name: ProfitLossRecognisedOnExchangingConstructionServicesForFinancialAsset2011
Original.description: The profit (loss) recognised on exchanging construction services for a financial asset in service concession arrangements. [Refer: Service concession arrangements [domain]; Profit (loss)]

Original.name: ProfitLossRecognisedOnExchangingConstructionServicesForIntangibleAsset2011
Original.description: The profit (loss) recognised on exchanging construction services for an intangible asset in service concession arrangements. [Refer: Service concession arrangements [domain]; Profit (loss)]

Original.name: WeightedAverageFairValueAtMeasurementDateShareOptionsGranted
Original.description: The weighted average fair value of share options granted during the period at the measurement date. [Refer: Weighted average [member]]

Original.name: ExpectedDividendShareOptionsGranted
Original.description: The amount of an expected dividend used to calculate the fair value of share options granted.

Original.name: WeightedAverageFairValueAtMeasurementDateOtherEquityInstrumentsGranted
Original.description: The weighted average fair value at the measurement date of granted equity instruments other than share options. [Refer: Weighted average [member]]

Original.name: IncrementalFairValueGrantedModifiedSharebasedPaymentArrangements
Original.description: The difference, for modified share-based payment arrangements, between the fair value of the modified equity instrument and that of the original equity instrument, both estimated as at the date of the modification. [Refer: Types of share-based payment arrangements [domain]]

Original.name: ExpenseFromEquitysettledSharebasedPaymentTransactionsInWhichGoodsOrServicesReceivedDidNotQualifyForRecognitionAsAssets
Original.description: The amount of expense arising from equity-settled share-based payment transactions in which the goods or services received did not qualify for recognition as assets, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Expense from share-based payment transactions, operating]

Original.name: ExpenseFromCashsettledSharebasedPaymentTransactionsInWhichGoodsOrServicesReceivedDidNotQualifyForRecognitionAsAssets
Original.description: The amount of expense arising from cash-settled share-based payment transactions in which the goods or services received did not qualify for recognition as assets, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Expense from share-based payment transactions, operating]

Original.name: ExpenseFromSharebasedPaymentTransactionsInWhichGoodsOrServicesReceivedDidNotQualifyForRecognitionAsAssets
Original.description: The amount of expense arising from share-based payment transactions in which the goods or services received did not qualify for recognition as assets, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss.

Original.name: ExpenseFromSharebasedPaymentTransactionsWithEmployees
Original.description: The amount of expense from share-based payment transactions with employees, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Expense from share-based payment transactions, operating]

Original.name: ExpenseFromSharebasedPaymentTransactionsWithPartiesOtherThanEmployees
Original.description: The amount of expense from share-based payment transactions with parties other than employees, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Expense from share-based payment transactions, operating]

Original.name: ExpenseFromSharebasedPaymentTransactionsInWhichGoodsOrServicesReceivedDidNotQualifyForRecognitionAsAssets
Original.description: The amount of expense arising from share-based payment transactions in which the goods or services received did not qualify for recognition as assets, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss.

Original.name: LiabilitiesFromSharebasedPaymentTransactions2011
Original.description: The amount of liabilities arising from share-based payment transactions. Share-based payment transactions are transactions in which the entity: (a) receives goods or services from the supplier of those goods or services (including an employee) in a share-based payment arrangement; or (b) incurs an obligation to settle the transaction with the supplier in a share-based payment arrangement when another group entity receives those goods or services. [Refer: Types of share-based payment arrangements [domain]]

Original.name: IntrinsicValueOfLiabilitiesFromSharebasedPaymentTransactionsForWhichCounterpartysRightToCashOrOtherAssetsVested2011
Original.description: The intrinsic value of liabilities arising from share-based transactions for which the counterparty's right to cash or other assets had vested by the end of the period (for example, vested share appreciation rights). The intrinsic value is the difference between the fair value of the shares to which the counterparty has the (conditional or unconditional) right to subscribe, or which it has the right to receive, and the price (if any) that the counterparty is (or will be) required to pay for those shares. Share-based payment transactions are transactions in which the entity: (a) receives goods or services from the supplier of those goods or services (including an employee) in a share-based payment arrangement; or (b) incurs an obligation to settle the transaction with the supplier in a share-based payment arrangement when another group entity receives those goods or services, for which the counterparty's right to cash or other assets had vested by the end of the period (for example, vested share appreciation rights).

Original.name: PostemploymentBenefitExpenseDefinedContributionPlans
Original.description: The amount of post-employment benefit expense relating to defined contribution plans, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. Defined contribution plans are post-employment benefit plans under which an entity pays fixed contributions into a separate entity (a fund) and will have no legal or constructive obligation to pay further contributions if the fund does not hold sufficient assets to pay all employee benefits relating to employee service in the current and prior periods.

Original.name: DefinedBenefitObligationAtPresentValue
Original.description: The present value, without deducting any plan assets, of expected future payments required to settle the obligation resulting from employee service in the current and prior periods. [Refer: Plan assets, at fair value]

Original.name: PlanAssetsAtFairValue
Original.description: The fair value of defined benefit plan assets. Plan assets comprise assets held by a long-term employee benefit fund and qualifying insurance policies. [Refer: At fair value [member]]

Original.name: SurplusDeficitInPlan
Original.description: The fair value of any plan assets, less the present value of the defined benefit obligation. [Refer: Plan assets [member]]

Original.name: AdministrationCostsNotReflectedInReturnOnPlanAssetsDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of administration costs in the current period related to defined benefit plans that are not reflected in the return on plan assets, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Administrative expenses, operating; Post-employment benefit expense in profit or loss, defined benefit plans, operating] [Contrast: Increase (decrease) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from administration costs not reflected in return on plan assets; Return on plan assets excluding interest income or expense, net of tax, defined benefit plans; Return on plan assets excluding interest income or expense, before tax, defined benefit plans]

Original.name: CurrentServiceCostDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The expense of employee service in the current period arising from defined benefit plans, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Post-employment benefit expense in profit or loss, defined benefit plans, operating] [Contrast: Increase in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from current service cost]

Original.name: InterestExpenseDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of interest expense arising from defined benefit plans, in the financing category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Interest expense; Post-employment benefit expense in profit or loss, defined benefit plans, operating] [Contrast: Increase (decrease) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from interest expense (income)]

Original.name: InterestIncomeDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of interest income arising from defined benefit plans, in the financing category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Interest income; Post-employment benefit expense in profit or loss, defined benefit plans, operating] [Contrast: Increase (decrease) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from interest expense (income)]

Original.name: InterestExpenseIncomeDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of interest expense (income) arising from defined benefit plans, in the financing category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Interest income (expense), operating; Post-employment benefit expense in profit or loss, defined benefit plans, operating] [Contrast: Increase (decrease) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from interest expense (income)]

Original.name: PastServiceCostDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of expense (income) resulting from past service cost, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. Past service cost is the change in the present value of the defined benefit obligation for employee service in prior periods, resulting from a plan amendment (the introduction or withdrawal of, or changes to, a defined benefit plan) or a curtailment (a significant reduction by the entity in the number of employees covered by a plan). [Refer: Post-employment benefit expense in profit or loss, defined benefit plans, operating; Defined benefit plans [domain]] [Contrast: Increase (decrease) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from past service cost]

Original.name: GainsLossesArisingFromSettlementsDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of income (expense) resulting from settlements, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. Settlements are transactions that eliminate all further legal or constructive obligations for part or all of the benefits provided under a defined benefit plan, other than a payment of benefits to, or on behalf of, employees that is set out in the terms of the plan and included in the actuarial assumptions. [Post-employment benefit expense in profit or loss, defined benefit plans, operating; Defined benefit plans [member]; Actuarial assumptions [member]] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from gains (losses) arising from settlements]

Original.name: PastServiceCostAndLossesGainsArisingFromSettlementsDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of expense (income) resulting from past service cost and losses (gains) arising from settlements, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Post-employment benefit expense in profit or loss, defined benefit plans, operating; Past service cost, defined benefit plans, operating] [Contrast: Increase (decrease) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from past service cost and losses (gains) arising from settlements]

Original.name: PostemploymentBenefitExpenseDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of post-employment benefit expense included in profit or loss relating to defined benefit plans, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Profit (loss); Defined benefit plans [domain]] [Contrast: Increase (decrease) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from expense (income) in profit or loss]

Original.name: WagesAndSalaries
Original.description: A class of employee benefits expense that represents wages and salaries, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Employee benefits expenses, operating]

Original.name: SocialSecurityContributions
Original.description: A class of employee benefits expense that represents social security contributions, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Employee benefits expenses, operating]

Original.name: OtherShorttermEmployeeBenefits
Original.description: The amount of expense from employee benefits (other than termination benefits), which are expected to be settled wholly within twelve months after the end of the annual reporting period in which the employees render the related services, that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Employee benefits expenses, operating]

Original.name: ShorttermEmployeeBenefitsExpense
Original.description: The amount of expense from employee benefits (other than termination benefits) that are expected to be settled wholly within twelve months after the end of the annual reporting period in which the employees render the related services, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss.

Original.name: PostemploymentBenefitExpenseDefinedContributionPlans
Original.description: The amount of post-employment benefit expense relating to defined contribution plans, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. Defined contribution plans are post-employment benefit plans under which an entity pays fixed contributions into a separate entity (a fund) and will have no legal or constructive obligation to pay further contributions if the fund does not hold sufficient assets to pay all employee benefits relating to employee service in the current and prior periods.

Original.name: PostemploymentBenefitExpenseDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of post-employment benefit expense included in profit or loss relating to defined benefit plans, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Profit (loss); Defined benefit plans [domain]] [Contrast: Increase (decrease) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from expense (income) in profit or loss]

Original.name: PostemploymentBenefitExpenseInProfitOrLoss
Original.description: The amount of post-employment benefit expense included in profit or loss, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss.

Original.name: TerminationBenefitsExpense
Original.description: The amount of expense in relation to termination benefits, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. Termination benefits are employee benefits provided in exchange for the termination of an employee's employment as a result of either: (a) an entity's decision to terminate an employee's employment before the normal retirement date; or (b) an employee's decision to accept an offer of benefits in exchange for the termination of employment. [Refer: Employee benefits expenses, operating]

Original.name: OtherLongtermBenefits
Original.description: The amount of long-term employee benefits other than post-employment benefits and termination benefits, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. Such benefits may include long-term paid absences, jubilee or other long-service benefits, long-term disability benefits, long-term profit-sharing and bonuses and long-term deferred remuneration. [Refer: Employee benefits expenses, operating]

Original.name: ExpenseFromSharebasedPaymentTransactionsWithEmployees
Original.description: The amount of expense from share-based payment transactions with employees, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss. [Refer: Expense from share-based payment transactions, operating]

Original.name: OtherEmployeeExpense
Original.description: The amount of employee expenses that the entity does not separately disclose in the same statement or note, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss.

Original.name: EmployeeBenefitsExpense
Original.description: The expense of all forms of consideration given by an entity in exchange for a service rendered by employees or for the termination of employment, in the operating category in the statement of profit or loss.

Original.name: ReturnOnPlanAssetsExcludingInterestIncomeOrExpenseNetOfTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, net of tax, resulting from the return on plan assets, excluding amounts included in interest expense (income) arising from defined benefit plans. The return on plan assets is interest, dividends and other revenue derived from the plan assets, together with realised and unrealised gains or losses on the plan assets, less any costs of managing plan assets and less any tax payable by the plan itself, other than tax included in the actuarial assumptions used to measure the present value of the defined benefit obligation. [Refer: Other comprehensive income; Defined benefit plans [domain]; Plan assets [member]; Other comprehensive income, net of tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from return on plan assets excluding interest income or expense]

Original.name: ActuarialGainsLossesArisingFromChangesInDemographicAssumptionsNetOfTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, net of tax, resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in demographic assumptions that result in remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset). Demographic assumptions deal with matters such as: (a) mortality; (b) rates of employee turnover, disability and early retirement; (c) the proportion of plan members with dependants who will be eligible for benefits; (d) the proportion of plan members who will select each form of payment option available under the plan terms; and (e) claim rates under medical plans. [Refer: Other comprehensive income, net of tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in demographic assumptions]

Original.name: ActuarialGainsLossesArisingFromChangesInFinancialAssumptionsNetOfTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, net of tax, resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in financial assumptions that result in remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset). Financial assumptions deal with items such as: (a) the discount rate; (b) benefit levels, excluding any cost of the benefits to be met by employees, and future salary; (c) in the case of medical benefits, future medical costs, including claim handling costs (ie the costs that will be incurred in processing and resolving claims, including legal and adjuster's fees); and (d) taxes payable by the plan on contributions relating to service before the reporting date or on benefits resulting from that service. [Refer: Other comprehensive income, net of tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in financial assumptions]

Original.name: ActuarialGainsLossesArisingFromExperienceAdjustmentsNetOfTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, net of tax, resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from experience adjustments that result in remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset). Experience adjustments deal with the effects of differences between the previous actuarial assumptions and what has actually occurred. [Refer: Other comprehensive income, net of tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from experience adjustments]

Original.name: GainsLossesOnChangesInEffectOfLimitingNetDefinedBenefitAssetToAssetCeilingExcludingInterestIncomeOrExpenseNetOfTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, net of tax, resulting from the gain (loss) on changes in the effect of limiting a net defined benefit asset to the asset ceiling, excluding amounts included in interest income or expense. [Refer:Other comprehensive income, net of tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from gain (loss) on changes in effect of limiting net defined benefit asset to asset ceiling excluding interest income or expense]

Original.name: OtherComprehensiveIncomeNetOfTaxGainsLossesOnRemeasurementsOfDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, net of tax, related to gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans, which comprise actuarial gains and losses; the return on plan assets, excluding amounts included in net interest on the net defined benefit liability (asset); and any change in the effect of the asset ceiling, excluding amounts included in net interest on the net defined benefit liability (asset). [Refer: Other comprehensive income; Defined benefit plans [domain]; Plan assets [member]; Net defined benefit liability (asset)] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from gain (loss) on remeasurement in other comprehensive income]

Original.name: ReturnOnPlanAssetsExcludingInterestIncomeOrExpenseBeforeTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, before tax, resulting from the return on plan assets, excluding amounts included in interest expense (income) arising from defined benefit plans. The return on plan assets is interest, dividends and other revenue derived from the plan assets, together with realised and unrealised gains or losses on the plan assets, less any costs of managing plan assets and less any tax payable by the plan itself, other than tax included in the actuarial assumptions used to measure the present value of the defined benefit obligation. [Refer: Other comprehensive income; Defined benefit plans [domain]; Plan assets [member]; Other comprehensive income, before tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from return on plan assets excluding interest income or expense]

Original.name: ActuarialGainsLossesArisingFromChangesInDemographicAssumptionsBeforeTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, before tax, resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in demographic assumptions that result in remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset). Demographic assumptions deal with matters such as: (a) mortality; (b) rates of employee turnover, disability and early retirement; (c) the proportion of plan members with dependants who will be eligible for benefits; (d) the proportion of plan members who will select each form of payment option available under the plan terms; and (e) claim rates under medical plans. [Refer: Other comprehensive income, before tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in demographic assumptions]

Original.name: ActuarialGainsLossesArisingFromChangesInFinancialAssumptionsBeforeTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, before tax, resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in financial assumptions that result in remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset). Financial assumptions deal with items such as: (a) the discount rate; (b) benefit levels, excluding any cost of the benefits to be met by employees, and future salary; (c) in the case of medical benefits, future medical costs, including claim handling costs (ie the costs that will be incurred in processing and resolving claims, including legal and adjuster's fees); and (d) taxes payable by the plan on contributions relating to service before the reporting date or on benefits resulting from that service. [Refer: Other comprehensive income, before tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from changes in financial assumptions]

Original.name: ActuarialGainsLossesArisingFromExperienceAdjustmentsBeforeTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, before tax, resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from experience adjustments that result in remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset). Experience adjustments deal with the effects of differences between the previous actuarial assumptions and what has actually occurred. [Refer: Other comprehensive income, before tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from actuarial gains (losses) arising from experience adjustments]

Original.name: GainsLossesOnChangesInEffectOfLimitingNetDefinedBenefitAssetToAssetCeilingExcludingInterestIncomeOrExpenseBeforeTaxDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, before tax, resulting from the gain (loss) on changes in the effect of limiting a net defined benefit asset to the asset ceiling, excluding amounts included in interest income or expense. [Refer: Other comprehensive income, before tax, gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from gain (loss) on changes in effect of limiting net defined benefit asset to asset ceiling excluding interest income or expense]

Original.name: OtherComprehensiveIncomeBeforeTaxGainsLossesOnRemeasurementsOfDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of other comprehensive income, before tax, related to gains (losses) on remeasurements of defined benefit plans, which comprise actuarial gains and losses; the return on plan assets, excluding amounts included in net interest on the net defined benefit liability (asset); and any change in the effect of the asset ceiling, excluding amounts included in net interest on the net defined benefit liability (asset). [Refer: Other comprehensive income; Defined benefit plans [domain]; Plan assets [member]; Net defined benefit liability (asset)] [Contrast: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from gain (loss) on remeasurement in other comprehensive income]

Original.name: DescriptionOfAmountsOfEntitysOwnFinancialInstrumentsIncludedInFairValueOfPlanAssets
Original.description: The fair value of the entity's own transferable financial instruments that are included in the fair value of defined benefit plan assets. [Refer: Plan assets, at fair value; Classes of financial instruments [domain]; Defined benefit plans [domain]]

Original.name: DescriptionOfAmountsOfPropertyOccupiedByEntityIncludedInFairValueOfPlanAssets
Original.description: The fair value of property occupied by the entity that are included in the fair value of defined benefit plan assets. [Refer: Plan assets, at fair value; Defined benefit plans [domain]]

Original.name: DescriptionOfAmountsOfOtherAssetsUsedByEntityIncludedInFairValueOfPlanAssets
Original.description: The fair value of other assets used by the entity that are included in the fair value of defined benefit plan assets. [Refer: Plan assets, at fair value; Defined benefit plans [domain]]

Original.name: EstimateOfContributionsExpectedToBePaidToPlan
Original.description: The estimate of the expected contributions to be made to a defined benefit plan for the next annual reporting period. [Refer: Defined benefit plans [domain]]

Original.name: EstimateOfBenefitPaymentsExpectedToBePaidFromDefinedBenefitPlan
Original.description: The estimate of the amounts expected to be paid from defined benefit plan in future. [Refer: Defined benefit plans [domain]; Maturity [axis]]

Original.name: LiabilityAssetOfDefinedBenefitPlans
Original.description: The amount of deficit or surplus in a defined benefit plan, adjusted for any effect of limiting a net defined benefit asset to the asset ceiling. [Refer: Defined benefit plans [domain]]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseInNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAssetResultingFromAdministrationCostsNotReflectedInReturnOnPlanAssets
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in the net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from administration costs in the current period, that are not reflected in return on plan assets. [Refer: Administrative expenses, operating; Net defined benefit liability (asset)] [Contrast: Administration costs not reflected in return on plan assets, defined benefit plans, operating; Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from return on plan assets excluding interest income or expense]

Original.name: CurrentServiceCostNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAsset
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in the net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from employee service in the current period. [Refer: Net defined benefit liability (asset)]

Original.name: InterestExpenseIncomeNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAsset
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in the net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from the passage of time. [Refer: Interest expense; Net defined benefit liability (asset)]

Original.name: PastServiceCostNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAsset
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in the net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from past service cost. Past service cost is the change in the present value of the defined benefit obligation for employee service in prior periods, resulting from a plan amendment (the introduction or withdrawal of, or changes to, a defined benefit plan) or a curtailment (a significant reduction by the entity in the number of employees covered by a plan). [Refer: Net defined benefit liability (asset); Defined benefit plans [domain]]

Original.name: GainsLossesArisingFromSettlementsNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAsset
Original.description: The decrease (increase) in the net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from settlements. Settlements are transactions that eliminate all further legal or constructive obligations for part or all of the benefits provided under a defined benefit plan, other than a payment of benefits to, or on behalf of, employees that is set out in the terms of the plan and included in the actuarial assumptions. [Refer: Net defined benefit liability (asset); Defined benefit plans [domain]; Actuarial assumptions [domain]]

Original.name: PastServiceCostAndGainsLossesArisingFromSettlementsNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAsset
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in the net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from past service cost and losses (gains) arising from settlements. [Refer: Decrease (increase) in net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from gains (losses) arising from settlements; Net defined benefit liability (asset)]

Original.name: IncreaseDecreaseInNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAssetResultingFromExpenseIncomeInProfitOrLoss
Original.description: The increase (decrease) in the net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from expense (income) included in profit or loss. [Refer: Net defined benefit liability (asset); Profit (loss)] [Contrast: Post-employment benefit expense in profit or loss, defined benefit plans, operating]

Original.name: ReturnOnPlanAssetsNetDefinedBenefitLiabilityAsset
Original.description: The decrease (increase) in the net defined benefit liability (asset) resulting from the return on plan assets, excluding amounts included in interest income or expense.
